trans-unit.source: Advise the customer to implement a different type of backup that saves time.
A user refuses your request to e-mail you their student ID number and password.
A user cannot connect to the network using a wireless router even after the proper security key has been installed.
A user can locate a file on the server but cannot download it.
Grant access to the files for the duration of the visit. When the consultant leaves, disable the account.

Open-Ended Questions
Inform the user that there was no such request. Gather information and warn others against this phishing attack.
Closed-Ended Questions
Change the user permissions on this file from read to read and execute.
Verify that the user's MAC address is listed in the MAC address filter table.
What problems are you experiencing with your computer or network?
What software has been installed on your computer recently?
What were you doing when the problem was identified?

What updates or patches have been installed on your computer?
Has anyone else used your computer recently?
Does the computer boot up successfully?
Have you changed your password recently?
Have you received any error messages on your computer?
Are you currently logged into the network?
A customer reports that a backup that was started the night before is still going.
A visiting consultant using a guest account cannot access needed files.
Client unable to connect via wireless while at office
